t: Psalm 71
God the Rock of Salvation
In*pn You, O Lord,*s I put my trust; Let*ld me never be put to shame.
Deliver*ld me in Your righteousness, and cause me to escape; Incline*ld Your ear to me, and save me.
Be*ld my strong refuge, To*ld which I may resort continually; You*ld have given the commandment to save me, For*ld You are*i my rock and my fortress.
Deliver*ln me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, Out*ld of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
For*ld You are my hope, O Lord God;*s You*ild are*i my trust from my youth.
By*ld You I have been upheld from birth; You*ld are He who took me out of my mother’s womb. My*ld praise shall*i be*i continually of You.
I*ln have become as a wonder to many, But*ld You are*i my strong refuge.
Let*ld my mouth be filled with*i Your praise And*ild with*i Your glory all the day.
Do*ln not cast me off in the time of old age; Do*ld not forsake me when my strength fails.
For*ld my enemies speak against me; And*ld those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together,
Saying,*ld “God has forsaken him; Pursue*ld and take him, for there*i is*i none to deliver him.”*i
O*ln God, do not be far from me; O*ld my God, make haste to help me!
Let*ld them be confounded and*i consumed Who*ld are adversaries of my life; Let*ld them be covered with*i reproach and dishonor Who*ld seek my hurt.
But*ln I will hope continually, And*ld will praise You yet more and more.
My*ld mouth shall tell of Your righteousness And*ild Your salvation all the day, For*ld I do not know their*i limits.
I*ld will go in the strength of the Lord God;*s I*ld will make mention of Your righteousness, of Yours only.
O*ln God, You have taught me from my youth; And*ld to this day*i I declare Your wondrous works.
Now*ld also when I*i am*i old and grayheaded, O*ld God, do not forsake me, Until*ld I declare Your strength to this*i generation, Your*ld power to everyone who*i is to come.
Also*ln Your righteousness, O God, is*i very high, You*ld who have done great things; O*ld God, who is*i like You?
You,*ild who have shown me great and severe troubles, Shall*ld revive me again, And*ld bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
You*ld shall increase my greatness, And*ld comfort me on every side.
Also*ln with the lute I will praise You— And*ild Your faithfulness, O my God! To*ld You I will sing with the harp, O*ld Holy One of Israel.
My*ld lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing to You, And*ld my soul, which You have redeemed.
My*ld tongue also shall talk of Your righteousness all the day long; For*ld they are confounded, For*ld they are brought to shame Who*ld seek my hurt.
